TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 144

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 144

div1.p: Personally Appeard before me a Justice of the peace Absolom Johnson and made solemn Oath that he had lost A Recpt given him by John [But]ler for Moses Austin and C° for three thousand seven hundred of Mineral and thirty pounds which is passed to his Credit on Sd Austins Books and that he has no other claim for Said Mineral Mine A Burton
